intro: Trigonella zaprjagaevii, commonly known as the Zaprjagaev's fenugreek, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
